greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the edge length of a regular heptagon with unit circumradius.
comment: The edge length e(m) of a regular m-gon is e(m) = 2*sin(Pi/m). In this case, m = 7, and the constant, a = e(7), is the smallest m for which e(m) is not constructible using a compass and a straightedge (see A004169). With an odd m, in fact, e(m) would be constructible only if m were a Fermat prime (A019434).
link: Stanislav Sykora, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, May 01 2016
